member.name: T:Microsoft.International.Formatters.EastAsiaNumericFormatter
member.summary: Provides a formatter class that converts the numbers in the numeric data types to a string with local numeric representation in East Asia languages.
member.remarks:
This class supports the following east Asia languages:
Chinese-Simplified
Chinese-Traditional
Japanese
Korean
This class supports the following format strings:
Standard Format(L): Also called upper-case.
Normal Format(Ln): Also called lower-case.
Currency Format(Lc): It's used to represent currency values.
Transliterate Format(Lt): Represent the numeric data in the characters of digit alphabet. Only supported in Japanese.
In order to explain how culture and format combination works, we will take "12345" as an example.
Chinese-Simplified
Standard: 壹万贰仟叁佰肆拾伍
Normal: 一万二千三百四十五
Currency: 壹万贰仟叁佰肆拾伍
Transliterate: ArgumentException will be thrown
Chinese-Traditional
Standard: 壹萬貳仟參佰肆拾伍
Normal: 一萬二千三百四十五
Currency: 壹萬貳仟參佰肆拾伍
Transliterate: ArgumentException will be thrown
Japanese
Standard: 壱萬弐阡参百四拾伍
Normal: 一万二千三百四十五
Currency: ArgumentException will be thrown
Transliterate: 一二三四五
Korean
Standard: 일만 이천삼백사십오
Normal: ArgumentException will be thrown
Currency: 일만 이천삼백사십오
Transliterate: ArgumentException will be thrown
Other Languages: ArgumentException will be thrown
Built-in numeric types are supported, including double, float, int, uint, long, ulong, short, ushort, sbyte, byte and decimal.
